name: HTTP POST Request
description: Make an HTTP POST request to any URL with JSON body, custom headers, query parameters, and URL parameters

url.label: URL
url.description: The full URL to make the POST request to. Supports variables like {{trigger_data.url}} or {{node_id.field}}. URL parameters can be set separately below.

url_params.label: URL Parameters
url_params.description: URL path parameters (e.g., /users/{id} -> id: 123). Use variables like {{trigger_data.user_id}}

query_params.label: Query Parameters
query_params.description: Query string parameters (e.g., ?page=1&limit=10). Use variables like {{trigger_data.page}}

headers.label: Headers
headers.description: HTTP headers as key-value pairs. Use variables like {{trigger_data.api_key}}. Content-Type: application/json is added automatically if not specified.

body.label: Request Body (JSON)
body.description: JSON request body. Use variables like {{trigger_data.content}} or {{node_id.field}}. Can be a JSON object or JSON string.

output_format.label: Output Format
output_format.description: How to format the response output. 'json' will parse and return structured data, 'void' will return no output.

output_schema.label: Output Schema (Optional)
output_schema.description: Define the expected JSON response structure with types. Only used when output_format is 'json'. Example: {"status": "string", "data": {"id": "number", "name": "string"}}
